p: We tested models of raw HPS incidence as well as model residuals for spatial autocorrelation using Moran’s I. We used the spatial contiguity matrix based on the Queen´s case neighborhood relation and treated each year separately. This test is commonly used and accepted as a fair evaluation of spatial autocorrelation and dependence [ 76], especially in disease studies [ 77, 78]. For all models and most years, we found no spatial autocorrelation, justifying the use of a non-spatial model.
